alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Meriwether; Pike; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:35PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Spalding, southern Fayette, northeastern Meriwether, northwestern Pike and southeastern Coweta Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1035 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Gay, or near Greenville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Griffin, Peachtree City, Senoia, Brooks, Williamson, Turin, Haralson, Gay, Rocky Mount, Starrs Mill, Hilltop, Vaughn, Hollonville, Alvaton, Rover, Digbey, Lake Horton, Zetella, Imlac and Wooster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central and west central Georgia.
